source.description:
Put the needed amount of blood sampl into a 
conical tube.
Add an equal volume of PBS 1X and mix well.

1.44 g (10 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rtbf","text":"KH2PO4 - 0.24 g (1.8 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1aiq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2nh4k","text":"To prepare 1 L of PBS 1X, dissolve the reagents listed above in 800 mL of ultrapure H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9d7ao","text":"Adjust the pH to 7.4 with HCl or NaOH, and then add H2O to 1 L.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1vrqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8epja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a05d8","text":"NaCl code: S9625, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dl8qu","text":"KCl code: P9541, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"19msp","text":"Na2HPO4 code: 1.06585, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4cko6","text":"KH2PO4 code: P0662, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3f8u5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cmlsp","text":"Fonte: (Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press 2006)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":49,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"389h","text":"This recepe is used in the following protocols:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1l0m1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ginf","text":"- Separation and purification of human PBMC from FRESH BLOOD","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d21r8","text":"- Separation and purification of human PBMC from BUFFY COAT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1haj","text":"- Magnetic bead-based CD4+ T cell isolation from PBMCs with Dynabeads: CD4 Positive Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9f3g","text":"- Magnetic bead-based TREG-TEFF cell isolation from PBMC with Miltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b700","text":"- Staining of human PBMC or ISOLATED SUBSETS with Cell Proliferation Dye-eFluor\u2122 670 (CPD-eFluor670) for cell proliferation evaluation by Flow Cytometry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Place 
of FICOLL in a
conical tube.

Carefully layer 
of diluted blood on FICOLL with a glass Pasteur Pipette to a final volume of 15 ml as shown in the figure below.

Centrifuge samples 
at room temperature (RT) without break.
After centrifugation, take out the tubes carefully to not disturb the mononuclear cell layer that appears as a white, cloudy band between the plasma and FICOLL as shown in the figure below.
Carefully with a glass Pasteur pipette transfer the mononuclear lymphocyte cell layer to another 15 ml conical tube.

Wash the isolated PBMC with PBS/FBS 2% to a final volume of 
 and centrifuge at
 
at RT.

source.title: SOLUTION- 05 - Wash solution (PBS/FBS) for PBMC

source.description:
Remove supernatants, resuspend pellet in 
of Lysis Buffer and add another 
of Lysis Buffer. Immediately centrifuge tubes at 
at RT.

of RPMI/FBS 10% for cell counting.

For manual cell count use Türk solution for checking purity.
Mix
of cell suspension with an equal amount of Türk solution (dilution factor = 2), allow mixture 3 min at room temperature.
Take
of the mixture and place it inside a Bürker chamber and view under an optical microscope using 40X magnification.
Count the cells in each square found in the four corners and in the central square (see figure 1 below), including those
that lie on the bottom and left-hand perimeters, but not those that lie on the top and right hand perimeters (see figure
2 below).
Total number of cells per ml = mean number of cells x dilution factor x 104 (hemacytometer volume).

source.title: SOLUTION- 08 - Türk solution

OPTIONAL STEP
For automatic cell count with Cellometer machine use Trypan Blue. The machine will calculate the n° of cells/ml and the % of viability.
Take
of cell suspension and add an equal amount of Trypan Blue. Use all the volume to place it in a counting chamber. Place the chamber inside Cellometer and count.

source.title: SOLUTION- 09 - Trypan Blue solution

source.document: {"blocks":[{"key":"2v234","text":"Trypan Blue solution 0.4%","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":25,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1o0c4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c8i7q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f9joa","text":"Prepare a dilution at 0.2%(v\/v): 0.4 mL of Trypan stock solution + 0.6 mL PBS or NaCl (final volume 1mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fsuoh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d8kin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c23gp","text":"Storage: 4\u00b0C in the dark (Prepare fresh every 2 weeks)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":29,"offset":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1kqhv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fg2at","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qbng","text":"Trypan blue catalog number: T8154-100mLSigma Italy","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":27,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

If needed, check the purity of PBMC suspension by using morphological parameter of the flow cytometer.
For this test 0.5x106 PBMC in 500 µl of PBS are enough.
Expected results

source.body:
VIABILITY - The expected viability by Trypan Blue should be ≥90 %.
PURITY - The PBMC suspension obtained should contain at least 80% of lymphocytes, 10-15% of monocytes and few contaminant PMN cells (≤ 5%) as confirmed by flow cytometry.
YIELD - The expected amount of PBMCs should be ± 28,5x106 starting from 25 ml of fresh blood.

description:
Separation and purification of PBMC from FRESH BLOOD: list of published work using this protocol
Kustrimovic, N., Comi, C., Magistrelli, L., Rasini, E., Legnaro, M., Bombelli, R., Aleksic, I., Blandini, F., Minafra, B., Riboldazzi, G., Sturchio, A., Mauri, M., Bono, G., Marino, F., & Cosentino, M. (2018). Parkinson's disease patients have a complex phenotypic and functional Th1 bias: cross-sectional studies of CD4+ Th1/Th2/T17 and Treg in drug-naïve and drug-treated patients. Journal of neuroinflammation, 15(1), 205. https://doi.org/10.1186/s12974-018-1248-8
Kustrimovic, N., Rasini, E., Legnaro, M., Bombelli, R., Aleksic, I., Blandini, F., Comi, C., Mauri, M., Minafra, B., Riboldazzi, G., Sanchez-Guajardo, V., Marino, F., & Cosentino, M. (2016). Dopaminergic Receptors on CD4+ T Naive and Memory Lymphocytes Correlate with Motor Impairment in Patients with Parkinson's Disease. Scientific reports, 6, 33738. https://doi.org/10.1038/srep33738
Cosentino M., Ferrari M., Kustrimovic N., Rasini E., Marino F. (2015). Influence of dopamine receptor gene polymorphisms on circulating T lymphocytes: A pilot study in healthy subjects. Human immunology, 76, 10, 747-752. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.humimm.2015.09.032
